unnormalised: ## Beyond the Blockbuster: Why You Should Check Out Film Festivals
normalised: ## beyond the blockbuster: why you should check out film festivals

unnormalised: Hey folks! Tired of the same old Bollywood masala and Hollywood CGI fests? Wanna see something real, something different, something… *artistic*? Then you gotta explore the world of film festivals!
normalised: hey folks! tired of the same old Bollywood masala and Hollywood C G I fests? wanna see something real, something different, something… *artistic*? then you gotta explore the world of film festivals!

unnormalised: Seriously, film festivals are where the magic happens. Forget waiting weeks for a 'Housefull' sign – these events are packed with films you won't find in your local PVR or Cinepolis. We’re talking indie gems, documentaries that’ll blow your mind, and experimental flicks that push the boundaries of cinema.
normalised: seriously, film festivals are where the magic happens. forget waiting weeks for a 'housefull' sign – these events are packed with films you won't find in your local P V R or Cinepolis. we’re talking indie gems, documentaries that’ll blow your mind, and experimental flicks that push the boundaries of cinema.

unnormalised: Think of it as a cultural buffet, but with stories instead of biryani (though, let’s be honest, sometimes I wish there *was* biryani involved!). You can travel (IRCTC pending, of course!) to exotic locations like Goa for IFFI (International Film Festival of India), which happens every year around November-December. They screen hundreds of films, give awards, and you might even spot a Bollywood celeb or two. Remember that Anurag Kashyap movie, "Gangs of Wasseypur"? It premiered at Cannes before hitting the Indian screens. That's the power of film festivals!

unnormalised: But you don't *have* to travel far. Many cities host smaller, but equally vibrant festivals. Think of the Mumbai Film Festival, or even smaller regional ones showcasing talent from places like Bihar or Kerala. They often offer workshops, Q&A sessions with filmmakers, and a chance to mingle with fellow film buffs.

unnormalised: So, why bother? Because these festivals expose you to perspectives you won't find anywhere else. They’re a breeding ground for new talent, a platform for underrepresented voices, and a fantastic way to broaden your cinematic horizons. Plus, you get to feel incredibly cultured.

unnormalised: This year, I'm planning to check out the Kolkata International Film Festival, happening sometime around Nov 5th to 12th! Apparently, they're showcasing some amazing Bengali films this year.

unnormalised: So, ditch the Netflix binge for a weekend and explore a film festival near you. You might just discover your new favorite filmmaker, or at least have a few interesting stories to tell at your next chai break. Maybe one day you too, could be celebrating a premiere at a festival, having traveled 2000 km to make it. Who knows?
